SpeechSynthesisEvent.summary: The SpeechSynthesisEvent interface of the Web Speech API contains information about the current state of objects that have been processed in the speech service.

SpeechSynthesisEventUtterance.summary: The utterance read-only property of the interface returns the instance that the event was triggered on.

SpeechSynthesisEventElapsedTime.summary: The elapsedTime read-only property of the returns the elapsed time in seconds, after the started being spoken, at which the event was triggered.
SpeechSynthesisEventElapsedTime.value:
A float containing the elapsed time, in seconds.
NOTEEarly versions of the specification required the elapsed time in milliseconds.
Check the compatibility table below for your browser.

SpeechSynthesisEventName.summary:
The name read-only property of the interface returns the name associated with certain types of events occurring as the is being spoken:
the name of the SSML marker reached in the case of a event, or the type of boundary reached in the case of a event.

SpeechSynthesisEventCharIndex.summary: The charIndex read-only property of the interface returns the index position of the character in that was being spoken when the event was triggered.

SpeechSynthesisEventSpeechSynthesisEvent.summary: The SpeechSynthesisEvent() constructor creates a new object.

blockquote.para: A web developer doesn't typically need to call this constructor, as the browser creates these objects itself when firing events.

SpeechSynthesisEventCharLength.summary: The read-only charLength property of the interface returns the number of characters left to be spoken after the character at the position.

remarks.para: If the speech engine can't determine it, it returns 0.
